definition: abbr. for Beijing/surname Jing/Jing ethnic minority
capital city of a country/big/algebraic term for a large number (old)/artificial mound (old)
texture/grain (of wood)/inner essence/intrinsic order/reason/logic/truth/science/natural science (esp. physics)/to manage/to pay attention to/to run (affairs)/to handle/to put in order/to tidy up
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

sentences.english: Employed as an associate professor in the Department of Culture Heritage , Design and Art School, Beijing Institute of Technology.
sentences.chinese: 張帆，北京理工大學設計藝術學院文化遺產系副教授。

sentences.english: We all come from Beijing Institute of Technology.
sentences.chinese: 我們都是來自北京理工大學的學生。

sentences.english: I'm a graduate of beijing Polytechnics.
sentences.chinese: 我是北京理工大學的畢業生。

sentences.english: Mr. Qi holds a Masters degree in computer science from Beijing Institute of Technology, China.
sentences.chinese: 齊先生在北京理工大學獲得了計算機科學的碩士學位。
